result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacari D Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence; release for inmate work assignments, and The Day Reporting Center; credit for 3 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Obtain/Maintain Full Time employment/school or a combination of both.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
Defendant may not be in any vehicle where a firearm is present.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at any one time.
No possession of more than 1 cell phone or more than 1 phone number listed under the Defendants name at one time.
Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.

timeConds.notes:
Without out good time credit; release for AODA treatment and work: work includes employment at La Quinta and personal care work for father. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
Defense request report date as to the condition time set in Count 1. State response. Court orders report date 5-4-2015 at 8:15 am, Branch 17. Court notes that the defendant is now under the terms and conditions of probation as set in Count 1 and Count 2 until the report date of 5-4-2015.

miscConds.notes: For the reasons placed on the record, the Court GRANTS the Defense request for expungement, upon successful completion of the probation as to COUNT 2 and DENIES the request for expungement as to COUNT 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacari D Lewis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Letter on behalf of defendant received and filed. tk

Defendant Jacari D Lewis in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for inmate work assignments, and The Day Reporting Center; credit for 3 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS with the below conditions.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Court ordered defendant to serve 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for inmate work assignments, and The Day Reporting Center; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 1 YEAR, concurrent to Count 1 with the following conditions:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at any one time.
- No possession of more than 1 cell phone or more than 1 phone number listed under the Defendants name at one time.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
-Defendant may not be in any vehicle where a firearm is present. 
- Obtain/Maintain Full Time employment/school or a combination of both.
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY:

- Court ordered 3 months of condition time in the House of Correction, without out good time credit; release for AODA treatment and work: work includes employment at La Quinta and personal care work for father. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
Defense request report date as to the condition time set in Count 1. State response. Court orders report date 5-4-2015 at 8:15 am, Branch 17. Court notes that the defendant is now under the terms and conditions of probation as set in Count 1 and Count 2 until the report date of 5-4-2015. 

Defense motions the Court to consider expungement. For the reasons placed on the record, the Court GRANTS the Defense request for expungement, upon successful completion of the probation as to COUNT 2 and DENIES the request for expungement as to COUNT 1. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Sentencing Referral Form;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  Sentencing proceeded.
Letter with miscellaneous attachments, received and filed.

Defendant Jacari D Lewis in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Paul Hauer for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Case proceeds to Plea Hearing only. 
AS TO COUNT  1 & 2 -  
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Case is adjourned for Sentencing on 4-29-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacari D Lewis in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For the reasons placed on the record the Court adjourns the case for Plea and Sentencing on 4-3-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. 
Court extends the deadline for the defense to file motions until 4/3/2015 by 8:30 a.m.  Calendar call scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacari D Lewis in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Scheduling Conference. Case is adjourned for Projected Plea and Sentencing on 3-17-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. Any Defense motions due 3-17-2015 by 8:30 a.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Calendar call scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacari D Lewis in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Ronald Dague on behalf of Brandon Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for preliminary hearing.   Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
The court ordered no use or possession of illegal drugs.

Defendant Jacari D Lewis in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   Defendant entered a plea of Not Guilty as to Misdemeanor Count 2.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1-30-2015 at 1:30pm
